display_asset.caption: A stenciled image attributed to Banksy depicting a poor child making Union flags on a sewing machine and is located on the wall of a Poundland discount shop in London.

summaries.body: Researchers using geographic profiling, used to track criminals, think they may have identified Banksy. The graffiti artist declined comment through a representative.

display_asset.caption: The Oconee Nuclear Station in Seneca, S.C., in 2005.

summaries.body: A fire at Oconee Nuclear Power Plant in South Carolina partly shut down the facility on Sunday, but caused no threat to the public, the company said.

display_asset.caption: The front and back of a rare Ty Cobb baseball card, one of seven recently discovered cards.

summaries.body: A handful of century-old baseball cards featuring Ty Cobb may net $1 million for their owner after they were found while cleaning out a great-grandparent’s home.

display_asset.caption: A total solar eclipse showing the sun’s corona as seen from Australia on Nov. 13 2012.

summaries.body: A total solar eclipse will begin on Wednesday and end the previous day on the other side of the international date line.

display_asset.caption: Tom Knight in 1982 at the grave site of Charles Ebbets, former owner of the Brooklyn Dodgers.

summaries.body: Tom Knight, the first and only official baseball historian of Brooklyn, has died at 89. He knew everything about the Dodgers.
The author of a new book about the rising power of unmarried women talks about what marriage has represented for women historically, and how it has changed.

display_asset.caption: Members of the lacrosse team at Bullis School in Potomac, Md., wearing soft-padded helmets. The push for headgear in the sport has gained traction.
display_asset.credit: Nate Pesce for The New York Times

summaries.body: Regulated protective headgear will soon be available for girls’ lacrosse teams in the United States, but some say its availability will only lead to more aggressive play.

display_asset.caption: In developing its new line of Good Thins crackers, Mondelez saw a demand for unconventional ingredients.

summaries.body: With a new line of crackers made from unconventional ingredients like sweet potatoes and chickpeas, Mondelez is chasing a larger slice of the $6.2 billion snack industry.
Researchers have found evidence to explain a recent epidemic of malnourished sea lion pups: Their mothers’ diets have suffered from a dearth of high-quality food sources.

display_asset.caption: A new volume of “The Complete Peanuts” features a foreword by a fan, President Obama.

summaries.body: “Like millions of Americans, I grew up with ‘Peanuts,’” President Obama wrote in the foreword for the 25th volume of “The Complete Peanuts.” “But I never outgrew it.”
Four overtimes and three buzzer-beaters? A regional basketball championship game between two Minnesota high schools is being called miraculous.

display_asset.caption: The media mogul Rupert Murdoch and the former model Jerry Hall posed for photographs in London on Friday.

summaries.body: Weeks after announcing their engagement, Rupert Murdoch, 84, and Jerry Hall, 59, were married at a centuries-old mansion in London.

display_asset.caption: Jenrry Mejia, pictured at his lawyer’s office on Thursday, is trying to fight his lifetime ban from baseball after three failed tests for performance-enhancing substances.
display_asset.credit: Christopher Gregory for The New York Times

summaries.body: Jenrry Mejia, the Mets pitcher who was permanently barred after three failed drug tests, claimed that Major League Baseball conspired to oust him.

display_asset.caption: Mushers drove dog teams down a ribbon of snow that was shipped in to snowless downtown Anchorage for the annual winter festival event.
display_asset.credit: Bill Roth/Alaska Dispatch News, via Associated Press

summaries.body: After a warm winter with less than half its normal snowfall, Anchorage, Alaska, had to import several train cars of snow for Saturday's start to the Iditarod sled dog race.

display_asset.caption: Oliver Jack Carter Lomas-Davis, then 3 months old, and Bernie Sanders at a rally in Las Vegas in February.

summaries.body: Jack Carter Lomas-Davis, the infant known as the Bernie Baby on social media after his mother took him to a rally dressed as Bernie Sanders, died of sudden infant death syndrome on Feb. 25. He was 4 months old.

display_asset.caption: O.J. Simpson in October 1995 after he was found not guilty in the murders of Nicole Brown Simpson and Ronald L. Goldman.

summaries.body: The Los Angeles police are testing a knife found years ago on the grounds where O.J. Simpson lived in 1994 at the time of the murders of his former wife and her friend.
Three white men accused of attacking a group of Hispanics playing soccer in a Los Angeles County park this week have been charged with hate crimes, the authorities said.

display_asset.caption: As part of Facebook’s new tax structure, the social network said it would report sales linked to its British operations, primarily from digital advertising, through its local subsidiary, instead of booking its British revenues through its Irish unit.

summaries.body: With American tech companies facing criticism for their European accounting, Facebook said it would report sales in Britain, instead of through its Irish unit, which could result in millions more in British taxes.

display_asset.caption: The Rev. Bijan Mirtolooi, left, and Craig Ellis, the pastor’s assistant, at WS Café, a weekly session at Redeemer Presbyterian Church on the Upper West Side. The sessions explore faith with those who are skeptical about it.
display_asset.credit: Michelle V. Agins/The New York Times

summaries.body: A new frontier of evangelism is seeking converts among a fervent and growing number of atheists in the United States.

display_asset.caption: Commuters on the Long Island Rail Road during evening rush hour.
display_asset.credit: Michael Appleton for The New York Times

summaries.body: Sleep deprivation affects the same brain receptors as marijuana use, a study says, leading to unnecessary food cravings.

display_asset.caption: Military delegates arrived for a session of the Chinese People’s Political Consultative Conference in Beijing on Friday.

summaries.body: China's military budget will rise by 7 percent to 8 percent this year, after years of double-digit increases, a senior official said.
Drone racing has become so established that some contests are offering million-dollar prizes.
A group that will represent gay Irish-Americans in the St. Patrick’s Day Parade this year celebrated Bill de Blasio’s decision to march for the first time as mayor.
Bird excrement caused the shutdown of the Indian Point nuclear power plant in New York for three days in December, a report found.

display_asset.caption: Aubrey McClendon in 2012. The oil and gas entrepreneur died in a car crash on Wednesday.

summaries.body: Aubrey ​McClendon, who died in a car crash a day after being indicted on bid-rigging charges, was trying to expand the shale boom in the days before he died.

display_asset.caption: Damion Scott on his rooftop in Hamilton Heights. Mr. Scott said he was unlawfully handcuffed by the police after he was locked out of his building.
display_asset.credit: Benjamin Petit for The New York Times

summaries.body: Damion Scott, a college lecturer, said two New York City police officers unlawfully handcuffed and searched him after he was locked out of his apartment building.
Lawmakers are pressing for the reinstatement of a Green Beret whose career was derailed after he helped beat up an Afghan militia commander who kept a boy sex slave.

display_asset.caption: Some American liberals have been daydreaming about a new life north of the border.

summaries.body: Thinking of emigrating to Canada pending the election results? You're not alone. There has been a surge in Twitter outbursts, Google searches and helpful how-to guides.

display_asset.caption: Demonstrators in Indianapolis last year after the State Legislature passed the Religious Freedom Restoration Act, which critics said could be used to discriminate against gay men and lesbians.

summaries.body: Conservatives are pushing more specific legal protections for opponents of gay rights but are meeting the same resistance that similar, but broader, legislation faced last year.

display_asset.caption: Leigh Anne Arthur, who had taught in Union County for more than a decade, in an image from a televised interview with WSPA-TV on Monday.

summaries.body: Students at a South Carolina high school have petitioned to reinstate a teacher who said she had to resign after a student took her phone and circulated a nude picture of her.
